back_cards.example_en: She prefers to eat raw vegetables for a healthy snack.
The factory processes raw materials into finished products.
The scientist analyzed raw data from the experiment.
His raw emotions were evident during the heated debate.
The raw recruit struggled during the first week of training.

back_cards.definition_en: Located inside or closer to the center
back_cards.example_en: The inner layer of the jacket keeps you warm.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to private thoughts or feelings
back_cards.example_en: She kept her inner doubts hidden from her team.

back_cards.definition_en: Central or core part of something
back_cards.example_en: The inner workings of the machine were complex.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to a small, exclusive group
back_cards.example_en: Only the inner circle of advisors knew the plan.
Meditation helped her find inner peace.
After the break, the meeting will proceed as planned.

back_cards.definition_en: To take the next step in a process
back_cards.example_en: Please proceed to the checkout counter after shopping.

back_cards.definition_en: To begin or undertake an action
back_cards.example_en: The team decided to proceed with the new project.

back_cards.definition_en: To advance in a formal or legal context
back_cards.example_en: The court will proceed with the trial next week.

back_cards.definition_en: To move in a specific direction
back_cards.example_en: The hikers proceeded cautiously down the steep trail.

back_cards.definition_en: To break or disregard a rule
back_cards.example_en: He was fined for violating the traffic laws.
The company violated her personal data by sharing it.

back_cards.definition_en: To defy or go against an agreement
back_cards.example_en: They violated the contract by missing deadlines.

back_cards.definition_en: To disrespect or defile something sacred
back_cards.example_en: Vandals violated the historic site with graffiti.

back_cards.definition_en: To harm or act against someone's rights
back_cards.example_en: The policy violates workers' rights to fair pay.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual display of data or information
back_cards.example_en: The sales chart showed a steady increase this year.
The captain studied the nautical chart before sailing.
Her song topped the music chart for weeks.
The project chart outlined all key milestones.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical record of patient data
back_cards.example_en: The doctor reviewed the patient's chart before the visit.

back_cards.definition_en: The speed of movement or activity
back_cards.example_en: She walked at a brisk pace to catch the bus.
He took a pace forward to get a better view.

back_cards.definition_en: The rate of progress in a process
back_cards.example_en: The project moved at a slow pace due to delays.
The runner found a steady pace during the race.

back_cards.definition_en: A manner of walking or running
back_cards.example_en: His confident pace impressed the audience.

back_cards.definition_en: The management of money or funds
back_cards.example_en: She studied finance to learn about investments.
The company secured finance for the new factory.

back_cards.definition_en: The financial system of an organization
back_cards.example_en: The school's finance was carefully monitored.
Public finance supports infrastructure projects.
He struggled with personal finance after losing his job.
She became the champion of the tennis tournament.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who fights for a cause
back_cards.example_en: He was a champion for environmental protection.

back_cards.definition_en: A defender or supporter of someone
back_cards.example_en: The teacher was a champion for her students' success.
This car is a champion in fuel efficiency.

back_cards.definition_en: A heroic figure in a story
back_cards.example_en: The legend told of a champion who saved the village.

back_cards.definition_en: To break suddenly with a sharp sound
back_cards.example_en: The twig snapped under her foot in the forest.
She snapped at him for interrupting her work.
He snapped a picture of the sunset with his phone.
The lid snapped shut before he could grab it.
Under pressure, she snapped and left the meeting.
The lawyer advised her client on the contract terms.
Please advise us of your arrival time.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a course of action
back_cards.example_en: The doctor advised rest to recover from the flu.
He advised the team on marketing strategies.

back_cards.definition_en: To counsel in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: The consultant advised the company on cost reduction.
Initially, the plan seemed too ambitious.

back_cards.definition_en: As the first step in a process
back_cards.example_en: She initially struggled with the new software.
Initially, the weather was sunny, but it rained later.

back_cards.definition_en: In the early stages of an event
back_cards.example_en: The project initially faced funding issues.
He initially contacted the team via email.
The advanced technology improved production speed.

back_cards.definition_en: At a higher level of skill or knowledge
back_cards.example_en: She enrolled in an advanced math course.

back_cards.definition_en: Far along in progress or time
back_cards.example_en: The project is in an advanced stage of completion.
The phone boasts advanced features like facial recognition.
Their advanced research led to a breakthrough.
Rain is unlikely this afternoon, so we can picnic.
It’s unlikely that he’ll finish the task by tomorrow.
Her promotion seemed unlikely due to her inexperience.
The movie’s plot was unlikely and hard to believe.
His calm reaction was unlikely in such a crisis.
The fence served as a barrier to keep animals out.
Language was a barrier to their communication.
High costs are a barrier to affordable healthcare.
The barrier shielded the workers from traffic.
Education can break the barrier of poverty.

back_cards.definition_en: To support or promote a cause
back_cards.example_en: She advocated for equal pay in the workplace.

back_cards.definition_en: To argue in favor of a policy
back_cards.example_en: He advocated for stricter environmental laws.

back_cards.definition_en: To recommend a course of action
back_cards.example_en: The doctor advocated for a healthier diet.

back_cards.definition_en: To speak on behalf of someone
back_cards.example_en: She advocated for her friend during the dispute.
They advocated for the homeless in the city.
The label on the jar listed the ingredients.
She rejected the label of being a perfectionist.
The designer label was known for quality clothing.

back_cards.definition_en: A descriptive term for a person
back_cards.example_en: He earned the label of a reliable worker.
The file label helped her find the document quickly.
The horror movie was too horrible to watch.
The weather was horrible during the camping trip.
She had a horrible headache after the long day.
His presentation was horrible and unprepared.
The crime was a horrible act of violence.
Caring for her family was a heavy burden.
Debt became a burden on their finances.
It’s my burden to ensure the project succeeds.
Unemployment is a burden on the economy.
Grief was a burden she carried silently.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of breaking a rule
back_cards.example_en: Speeding is a violation of traffic laws.
The search was a violation of her privacy.
Late delivery was a violation of the contract.
The scandal was a violation of public trust.
Pollution caused a violation of environmental laws.
Unlike her brother, she loves spicy food.
This phone is unlike any other on the market.
Unlike last year, the event was well-attended.

back_cards.definition_en: Not typical of a person’s behavior
back_cards.example_en: Unlike him, she was always punctual.
Unlike traditional methods, this approach is faster.
He felt like an idiot after forgetting his lines.
The idiot ignored the warning signs and got hurt.
Only an idiot would drive in that storm.
She muttered ‘idiot’ when he spilled her drink.
They called him an idiot for his silly joke.

back_cards.definition_en: The duration of a person’s life
back_cards.example_en: She cherished memories from her lifetime.
This opportunity comes once in a lifetime.
The lifetime of this battery is two years.
He was a teacher for his entire lifetime.
Meeting her idol was a lifetime achievement.
The machine is in working order now.
She balanced her working life with family time.
The working team finished the project early.
They developed a working model of the invention.
The working conditions were safe and fair.
The ongoing investigation may take weeks.
They have an ongoing discussion about policy.
The construction is an ongoing project.
Her ongoing efforts improved the community.
The team monitors ongoing trends in the market.
She didn’t react well to the bad news.
He reacted with surprise to the gift.
The patient didn’t react to the medication.
The chemicals react when mixed together.

back_cards.definition_en: To act in response to an event
back_cards.example_en: The crowd reacted loudly to the goal.
Her morning routine includes yoga and coffee.
The hospital follows a strict routine for surgeries.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of habits or tasks
back_cards.example_en: His daily routine keeps him productive.
The comedian’s routine made everyone laugh.
The job became a boring routine over time.
Her presentation on climate change was engaging.
The chef’s presentation of the dish was stunning.
The team prepared a presentation for the client.
His clear presentation impressed the audience.
The presentation of the trophy was emotional.
He packed his camping gear for the trip.
The car’s gear was stuck in neutral.
She wore protective gear for the bike ride.

back_cards.definition_en: Tools or supplies for a task
back_cards.example_en: The painter brought all his gear to the site.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting for speed or power
back_cards.example_en: The truck shifted to a higher gear.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to Mexico or its culture
back_cards.example_en: She cooked a Mexican dish for the party.
The Mexican artist showcased vibrant paintings.
They celebrated with Mexican music and dance.
The store sells authentic Mexican pottery.
The film captured the Mexican landscape beautifully.
The stadium was packed for the championship game.
The concert was held in an outdoor stadium.
The new stadium hosts track and field events.
The town’s stadium is a source of pride.
The stadium’s lights illuminated the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: To convert text into another language
back_cards.example_en: She translated the book from Spanish to English.
He translated complex ideas into simple terms.

back_cards.definition_en: To adapt to a new context
back_cards.example_en: The software translates data for analysis.
She translated the poem’s meaning for the class.

back_cards.definition_en: To apply to a different field
back_cards.example_en: His skills in art translated to graphic design.
They took out a mortgage to buy their house.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial agreement with a bank
back_cards.example_en: The mortgage payments were a big expense.
The house was under a mortgage until 2030.
Their mortgage required careful budgeting.
The bank offered a low-rate mortgage.
The sheriff arrested the suspect yesterday.
The sheriff patrolled the small town regularly.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure in charge of court duties
back_cards.example_en: The sheriff served the eviction notice.
The sheriff spoke at the town meeting.
The old west sheriff was a legendary figure.
She visited the clinic for a check-up.
The dental clinic was busy all day.

back_cards.definition_en: A health service for a community
back_cards.example_en: The free clinic helped low-income families.
Medical students worked at the clinic.
The flu shot clinic was held at school.
The dancer spun gracefully on stage.

back_cards.definition_en: To create a narrative or perspective
back_cards.example_en: The politician tried to spin the story positively.
He spun the basketball on his finger.
The machine spins cotton into thread.

back_cards.definition_en: To move in a dizzying way
back_cards.example_en: Her head spun after the rollercoaster ride.

back_cards.definition_en: A group united for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The coalition worked to protect the environment.
The parties formed a coalition to govern.
The coalition raised funds for charity.
The business coalition tackled trade issues.
The coalition of volunteers cleaned the park.

back_cards.definition_en: In a natural or expected way
back_cards.example_en: She naturally excelled at public speaking.
His charm came naturally during the interview.
The project naturally evolved over time.
The flowers grew naturally in the meadow.
Her talent developed naturally from a young age.
She spoke hopefully about her new job.
Hopefully, the weather will clear up soon.
Hopefully, we’ll finish the project on time.
He applied hopefully for the scholarship.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that inspires hope
back_cards.example_en: The team worked hopefully toward their goal.
The restaurant’s menu featured Italian dishes.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of choices in a program
back_cards.example_en: The software’s menu was easy to navigate.
The spa’s menu included massages and facials.
She checked the menu before hosting dinner.
The café’s menu was written on a chalkboard.
The smooth road made driving pleasant.
The event went smooth without any issues.
His smooth speech won over the audience.
The smooth jazz music relaxed everyone.
Her dance moves were smooth and graceful.
The company’s advertising boosted sales.
She works in advertising for a major firm.
Their advertising was creative and eye-catching.
The event’s advertising attracted a large crowd.
Effective advertising shaped their brand image.

back_cards.definition_en: To explain the meaning of something
back_cards.example_en: She interpreted the poem for the class.
He interpreted the speech from French to English.

back_cards.definition_en: To understand in a certain way
back_cards.example_en: They interpreted his silence as agreement.

back_cards.definition_en: To analyze or make sense of
back_cards.example_en: The scientist interpreted the data carefully.
The actor interpreted the role with passion.
She dismissed the idea as impractical.
The manager dismissed the employee for tardiness.
The teacher dismissed the class early.
He dismissed their concerns as irrelevant.
The court dismissed the case due to lack of evidence.
Her disappointment was apparent to everyone.
The apparent cause of the fire was a short circuit.
The storm’s apparent strength worried the sailors.
There was an apparent change in his attitude.
The solution seemed apparent but needed testing.
She made an arrangement for the meeting.
The seating arrangement was perfect for the event.
The band played a new arrangement of the song.
They reached an arrangement to share costs.
The floral arrangement brightened the room.
She incorporated feedback into her project.
The chef incorporated spices into the recipe.
They incorporated their business last year.
The design incorporated modern trends.
The plan incorporated everyone’s suggestions.
They split the pizza among the group.
The wood split when he chopped it.
We split the cost of the trip evenly.
He split from the party before midnight.
The issue split the team into two groups.
Her brilliant idea solved the problem.
The sunset cast a brilliant glow over the lake.
His performance in the play was brilliant.
The scientist’s brilliant mind led to discoveries.
The brilliant stars lit up the night sky.
They rented a storage unit for their furniture.
Proper storage keeps food fresh longer.
The phone has 128GB of storage.
The warehouse offers storage for businesses.
Cold storage is used for perishable items.
The framework for the project was well-designed.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of rules or ideas
back_cards.example_en: The legal framework governs business practices.
The house’s framework was made of steel.
The framework helped analyze the data.
The software framework sped up coding.
